intro: Cyphostemma chrysadenium, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by orange or red berries. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. Cyphostemma chrysadenium is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
